definition: to recuperate/to convalesce/to take care of one's health after illness
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth

sentences.english: Molly after discharge, with little moxa came to a new home for illness.
sentences.chinese: 出院後莫利文帶小艾來到新的住處養病。

sentences.english: People who cannot find time for recreation are obtiged sooner or later to find time for illness.
sentences.chinese: 擠不出時間休息娛樂的人遲早會被迫擠出時間養病。

sentences.english: He went to the country to recuperate.
Since escaping the Jingzhou catastrophe, I've been recuperating at Bao Hamlet.
sentences.chinese: 自荊州失陷，逃難在鮑家莊養病。

sentences.english: Well you at ease and recuperate.
People who cannot find time for recreation are obliged sooner or later to find time for illness.
sentences.chinese: 擠不出時間休息娛樂的人遲早會被迫擠出時間養病。

sentences.english: Tom: I was at home, recovering.
Christmas day the condition has not changed for the better, still recuperates in the home.
sentences.chinese: 聖誕節病情也沒有好轉，依然在家養病。

sentences.english: Westwood did not play in Andalucia because he was at home resting his injured calf.
sentences.chinese: 伍德因腿傷在家養病未能出戰安達盧西亞賽。

sentences.english: The doctor ordered her to stay in bed.
The doctor told me to sign off.
sentences.chinese: 醫生讓我停止工作養病。

definition: to die of old age/to die in one's bed at a ripe old age
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
